text:
Your body fails before your will does. You collapse beside a cairn overgrown with moss and bone. The stones are old, placed not by hand but by sorrow. Whispers rise from beneath the mound, recounting tales of those who reached this place and chose to rest.

In the moments between consciousness, you see a face you should not rememberâ€”eyes like dying stars. It says nothing, but you feel its question burning within: 'Will you rise again, or will you join the pile?'
lore: The cairn marks the grave of the first Nameless Flame. She burned so bright the world forgot her name. Those who fall here are said to sleep beneath her gaze, neither living nor ash.
